Package it.kibo.fp.lib

Class InputData

java.lang.Object
it.kibo.fp.lib.InputData
public final class InputData extends Object
The class InputData can read a specific data type inserted in input by the user.It also allows the possibility to make controls on the data inserted.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Alessandro Muscio

  • Method Details

    • readString

      public static String readString(String message, boolean alphanumeric)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user. If it isn't a String an error message is printed. It's also possible to select if the inserted text needs to be alphanumeric or not.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      alphanumeric - If the input needs to be alphanumeric or not.
      Returns:
      A String representing the user input.

    • readNonEmptyString

      public static String readNonEmptyString(String message, boolean alphanumeric)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user, given that it isn't empty. If it isn't a String an error message is printed. It's also possible to select if the inserted text needs to be alphanumeric or not.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      alphanumeric - If the input needs to be alphanumeric or not.
      Returns:
      A String representing the user input.

    • readChar

      public static char readChar(String message, String allowed)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user. It will take the first char in it and verify if it is in the allowed characters, if not, an error message will be printed.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      allowed - All the allowed characters.
      Returns:
      A char representing the character tha was read.

    • readChar

      public static char readChar(String message)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user, it will take the first char in it.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      Returns:
      A char representing the character tha was read.

    • readInteger

      public static int readInteger(String message)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user. It will print an error message if the text inserted isn't an integer.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      Returns:
      An int representing the integer that was read.

    • readIntegerWithMinimum

      public static int readIntegerWithMinimum(String message, int min)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user. It will print an error message if the text inserted isn't an integer or if the integer inserted isn't greater equal than min.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      min - The minimum value to read.
      Returns:
      An int representing the integer that was read.

    • readIntegerWithMaximum

      public static int readIntegerWithMaximum(String message, int max)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user. It will print an error message if the text inserted isn't an integer or if the integer inserted isn't less equal than max.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      max - The maximum value to read.
      Returns:
      An int representing the integer that was read.

    • readIntegerBetween

      public static int readIntegerBetween(String message, int min, int max)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user. It will print an error message if the text inserted isn't an integer or if the integer inserted isn't between or equal than min and max.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      min - The minimum value to read.
      max - The maximum value to read.
      Returns:
      An int representing the integer that was read.

    • readDouble

      public static double readDouble(String message)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user. It will print an error message if the text inserted isn't a double.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      Returns:
      A double representing the double that was read.

    • readDoubleWithMinimum

      public static double readDoubleWithMinimum(String message, double min)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user. It will print an error message if the text inserted isn't a double or if the double inserted isn't greater equal than min.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      min - The minimum value to read.
      Returns:
      A double representing the double that was read.

    • readDoubleWithMaximum

      public static double readDoubleWithMaximum(String message, double max)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user. It will print an error message if the text inserted isn't a double or if the double inserted isn't less equal than max.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      max - The maximum value to read.
      Returns:
      An double representing the double that was read.

    • readDoubleBetween

      public static double readDoubleBetween(String message, double min, double max)
      Prints message in the terminal and reads the text inserted by the user. It will print an error message if the text inserted isn't an double or if the double inserted isn't between or equal than min and max.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to print.
      min - The minimum value to read.
      max - The maximum value to read.
      Returns:
      An double representing the double that was read.

    • readYesOrNo

      public static boolean readYesOrNo(String question)
      Prints question in the terminal with the string "? [Y/n] " added. If the user answers with 'y' or 'Y' the method will return true, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      question - The question to print.
      Returns:
      A boolean representing the affirmative or negative answer of the user.
